ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Method to conduct research; different behavioral economics theories
I learned more about the psychology side of behavioral economics and had a good reminder to be a skeptical reader of research
Learned a lot about behavioral economics!
The material was interesting, but I feel like I didn't learn anything from the course.
Behavioral Economics teaches critical thinking, how to conduct research experiments and how to write research papers. The topics could not be more interesting.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I thought this was a good course overall. I might recommend reading and discussing more recent behavioral economics papers.
Strength: cover a lot of material Weakness: 3 hours is a long time to have a class, even if we have a break in the middle
The course was extremely disorganized. Shane and the TA didn't seem to care about the class at all. They never uploaded lectures online and liked to send out last minute announcements.
BEST course that I have taken. It is so fascinating because of both Professor Frederick and Andrew. It was a bit unorganized but they made my efforts worthwhile

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I found this course to be fun without at all feeling like it was so fun/ frivolous that I didn't learn anything.

I think this class is great for someone interested in behavioral economics and psychology. I was very interested in the subject and found some of the material fascinating, but overall I was disappointed with the class. I came in expecting to learn more about a personal favorite subject of mine; ultimately I got turned off by the way the class was run. Help was not available, problem sets were too difficult and the grading too arbitrary. It was also very disorganized with last-minute assignments and updates. However, I do appreciate how dedicated Shane is to making the class engaging and entertaining. But I still would strongly recommend you look elsewhere.
Frederick is a great lecturerer. The 3 hour class flies by. The material is interesting. Frederick (and TF Andrew) bring the material to life.
There are particular students that would love the course. It is certainly not for everyone but these students who find the dynamics of the class good will have the best time with it.
